eventName: So Long, Adele: Home Away From Home
storyInfo: Eyjafjalla is occupied with recovering the exhibit 'stolen' by the Little Black Sheep, but finds herself coaxed by Dolly into 'enjoying life.' Amidst all the chaos, her pursuit finds her inside the Mockingbird Café, where a conversation with Eyjafjalla prompts the owner's grandson, Costa, to recall the Keller of the past.

attributes.content: Oh, looks like you're all done sorting. Nice job.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Mr. Dolly! Shouldn't you keep an eye or two on your clones?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Do you know how much trouble they'll make for everyone, letting them run amok like this?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: The fluffy creature stands by a container, its head stooped very low, seemingly conveying some apology to the person in front of it.
I told you, not all of them are me.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: I did bring them here, true... but I'm only indirectly to blame here, right?
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: So... sorry?
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Just saying sorry isn't going to fix this!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: If their merchandise gets damaged, what are the shopkeepers going to do? Your clones are being nuisances! Can't you do anything to stop them?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: I do actually have something... um, under normal circumstances, I could choose to 'Cry'.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: 'Cry'?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Like this. I face into whatever, the sea, the wasteland, and lift two hooves up like this, and then I yell: 'Heeeeeeeey! Where are you guys?! Come here quick!' Like that.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Adele, you're going to have to help me for that. I've Cried too many times, so sometimes they act like they haven't heard me.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: So... we just have to call them over?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: We need something to lure them too. Like, 'Ice cream here!' or 'We've got balloons and skateboards!' and stuff.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: But remember, don't call them 'Little Black Sheep' or 'lambs'. They won't even know you mean them.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Dolly looks expectantly up at Adele.
Ahem...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Heeeeeey! Ice cream here!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Heeeeeeeey! We have balloons and skateboards! Come here quick!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: What? Ice cream? Is it free?
attributes.name: Female Tourist

attributes.content: Miss, is it true? I want strawberry!
attributes.name: Child Tourist

attributes.content: Is there some kind of event? Are you giving out balloons?
attributes.name: Male Tourist

attributes.content: Huh? No, um...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Adele turns, looking to point out the deed-doer. Dolly's jumped up onto the neighboring containers, running circles around them like a deflating balloon.
But the pedestrians just don't see it.
Uh-oh, something's happened.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: You're gonna have to go get ice cream with them to fix this, and probably buy balloons too, and ramble the streets, and soak up the Siestan sun.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Tough one, huh? What a big coincidence that I know of a really good ice cream shop.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: How about I lead the way?
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: ...Mr. Dolly!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: So this is how you corral visitors into your Volcano Museum? Buying ice cream for strangers? I think I like this!
attributes.name: Female Tourist

attributes.content: Dearie, how about we spend the afternoon exploring the museum?
attributes.name: Female Tourist

attributes.content: Perfect! Then after that we'll go for barbecue!
attributes.name: Male Tourist

attributes.content: Let's go!
attributes.name: Female Tourist

attributes.content: Er, thank you very much.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Adele sees the group off, and looks around, trying to find any trace of Dolly.
In the stream of pedestrians, Dolly has all but vanished already. All that's there is a lone Little Black Sheep, staring pointedly at a wallet 'turning' into bills in a wandering tourist's hands.
(What's it about to do?)
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Right as the tourist and shopkeep are haggling, it leaps forth—
And in one chomp, makes off with the tourist's wallet.
(Huh?!)
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Where'd my wallet go?! Someone stole my wallet!
attributes.name: Male Tourist

attributes.content: Huh? What kind is it? Dark or light?
attributes.name: Siestan Citizen

attributes.content: Just now? But I didn't see anyone, did you?
attributes.name: Siestan Citizen

attributes.content: (Oh, no, Mr. Dolly's not here either! I have to catch it, quick!)
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: The Little Black Sheep holding the wallet notices Adele, opens its mouth, and the wallet falls out—
Then with a kick of its hoof, it goes sailing through the air, and falls back down straight into its wool.
(Delighted trots)
attributes.name: Fluffy Creature

attributes.content: Then it seems the wallet hits something with a 'bang', and a pebble full of holes shoots out from the Little Black Sheep's coat.
That's—the whistling rock!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: The Little Black Sheep looks back, and before the rock lands, it kicks again with its hoof to send it flying straight back in.
And after all that, it sticks its tongue out at Adele with an impish expression, and turns to gallop down Fashion Street.
Hey! Wait up!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Give everyone their stuff back—
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Errored three-dollar gold certs are rare collectibles here. They'll fetch a big price at the trade fair! Miss, are you sure you won't think about it? I've got a price I can give you!
attributes.name: Coin Dealer

attributes.content: The dealer gestures out a number.
Really? Could you take a look at this, then?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: This is old Higashinese issue! I'll take it for this much!
attributes.name: Coin Dealer

attributes.content: And this?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: A Gaulish copper livre—I'll take it too! Miss, what else have you got? Bring it all out!
attributes.name: Coin Dealer

attributes.content: Miss, how much did you bring? Last one, I swear, the very last one... I'll take one more, and then I'm going home!
attributes.name: Coin Dealer

attributes.content: Th—Then take a look at this! After this, I could afford a whole new device!
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Ahhh, it's our own Sargonian mint... Let me see, we've got...
attributes.name: Coin Dealer

attributes.content: —Gavial!?!
attributes.name: Coin Dealer

attributes.content: Yep! Is that valuable?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Valuable? No! This is the end of our talk! I don't do ANY business with thin-tails! You take all of this back! I'm leaving!
attributes.name: Coin Dealer

attributes.content: The dealer grabs a handful of loose coinage and furiously shoves it into Snowsant's hands, attempting to leave.
Suddenly, something speeds by, knocking the coins right out of his grip.
Money rains gold and glittering to the high street pavement, and before Snowsant can yelp in surprise, a pink shadow follows right after, running into the distance.
Uh... uh, Eyjafjalla?
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: Sorry, Snowsant... I...!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Blargh! What the hell?!
attributes.name: Coin Dealer

attributes.content: Wait, my coins... I'm missing two!
attributes.name: Snowsant

attributes.content: D—Don't look at me!
attributes.name: Coin Dealer

attributes.content: Clink! The fluffy creature stashes the gleaming little roundlets into its own wool.
Mr. Eastman! I'm here to pick up my photocopies.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Right, right, all these fliers of yours. You really put your back in, printing this much just to advertise your bar.
attributes.name: Print Shop Owner

attributes.content: 298, 299... that's exactly right. Here's the fee!
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: I'm not taking money off you for this. I'll just say, next time I drop in at the White Volcano, mix me your house Oasis, heavy on the ground cardamom. Appreciate it.
attributes.name: Print Shop Owner

attributes.content: Also, can you help change out my shop sign one minute?
attributes.name: Print Shop Owner

attributes.content: Of course I can! Thank you!
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: —Ah, Mr. Enis!
attributes.name: Adele
Enis
attributes.content: Adele...?

attributes.name: Enis
attributes.content: What's the hurry?
Look out... Look out!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Before Enis can react, a giant force smacks straight into him. Sent airborne for an instant, he sees Siesta upside down, and paper scattering everywhere.
Oof... ow, ouch, ow... what just...
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: The Little Black Sheep snatches a flier in its mouth and resumes its straightaway gallop.
Ah, Mr. Enis! I—I'm sorry!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Huh...?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Several stare as Adele shrinks into the horizon, giving chase to a 'flier blowing in the wind'.
*whistle* Times really are a-changing. Youngsters have such urgent schedules these days.
attributes.name: Print Shop Owner

attributes.content: Weird, what knocked me over just now...? I've never seen anything as strange as this...
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: CRASHHH!
The Eastman Print Shop's sign falls down, and lands right where Enis was still standing a moment ago.
...Wurgh!
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Where did it go...?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: It's like hide-and-seek!
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Mr. Dolly, this isn't the time to play around! If we don't catch the Little Black Sheep soon, more people are going to lose their things!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: No-no-no, they aren't going to lose anything, they're just borrowing it for a little fun. They'll give it all back.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Actually, why do YOU never play with children your age? Are you just going to keep yourself shut in a lab, even on a summer like this?
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Mr. Dolly, I'm not a child anymore, and studying Mount Siesta is a VERY important job which I shouldn't be distracted from.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: But right now, finding these Little Black Sheep is more important so we can stop them causing a ruckus!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: I know how lonely children work. I know how many love using 'I'm busy with work' as an excuse.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: This shop looks empty, but the Little Black Sheep just...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Er... who are you?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Excuse me, I... I lost my pet, it ran off! I think I saw it enter this coffee shop just now...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Adele blabbers as she lifts her head, and sees 'Mockingbird Café' in pretty type across the shop door.
This cafe went out of business a year ago. The door's always locked.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: But I definitely saw it wriggle inside just now, straight through...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: What kind of pet did you lose...?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: A... um, a beckbeast.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Ah, nono! Don't you associate my clones with those animals...
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Okay... a beckbeast.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Costa feels around in his pocket and pulls out a key, which he inserts, twists, and with a few ancient-sounding creaks, the door yawns open.
It's dark inside. All the blinds are down, repelling much of the sunlight from entering.
The air stirs with dust, and a yesteryear aroma of coffee.
Is your beckbeast in here?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Ngh, I don't think it is...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: I'm so sorry! Sorry to bother you...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: That's fine, I was just here to pick up a few things anyway.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: The property deed should be right... no, not there...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Sir, are you the owner of this cafe?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Not any more, I won't be. This shop, and all the shops on this street, are due to be demolished soon.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: I'm so sorry...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Don't be. The demolition isn't news to anyone here... *hisses* Not in this cupboard either...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Sir, what does it look like, the thing you're looking for? I can help you, maybe?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: It's a red binder...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Ungh, it really is dark...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Girl, are you sure you can see anything in here?
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Wuh!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: The place closed ages ago. Might be tricky to get the lights on.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: It's fine if we can't find it, I'm not in that big of a rush. Carry on searching for your pet, I'll... I'll keep an eye out for you.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Come on, girl! There's no clones of mine here and no whatever you're looking for! Off to the next location!
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: It's all pitch-black... I can't see a thing. Nothing like when I went surfing in Siesta before!
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: So, what does it look like?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Er, it's a pink and white... beckbeast, carrying a volcanic rock on it, the kind that whistles in the wind.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: That whistles in the wind... is it named 'whistling rock'?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Eh? Yes, it is. How do you know?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Costa continues rummaging. He pulls open a dust-caked cupboard, out of which falls a vintage guitar, smashing straight onto his knee.
Plinnnng!
Ah! Sir, are you alright?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: The sound of the guitar's impact rings in the air, a lingering acoustic hum, as if someone was playing on it.
—They sound just like that when blown across, those stones. Like you could perform music on them.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Urgh, I'm getting sidetracked.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Mrroah, the romance. Whistling rocks are like guitars? How did I never think of that?
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Is your pet carrying one of those? That's an odd luxury. If I remember right, it's fairly uncommon...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: It took it all by itself...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: You're going to humiliate me. Don't tell people my clones are kleptomaniacs.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Okay, if I see it, I'll get in touch with you. How should I go about doing that...?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Oh, thank you! Please contact the Volcano Museum if you can; I'm one of the staff there. My name's Adele.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: With another mysterious bump, all the old odds and ends in the cupboard slump into a landslide across the floor, burying the guitar beneath.
Dammit...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Sir, are you sure you don't need help? It seems like you're...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Not in that good of a... mood...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: A book falls into Adele's view. Under the light from outside, she parses its title clearly.
The Atlas of Terra's Volcanoes? Are you interested in volcanology, too?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: No, I'm... well, no, it's not as if I hate it.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Er, I mean, this isn't my book.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Let's get outside for now.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: You work at the Volcano Museum? Do you know a... Keller?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: I know Professor Keller. Are you friends?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: She used to be a... regular here, I guess.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: One summer, she suddenly left Siesta, together with two Leithanians. I never got in touch with her after that...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: How's she been? She's... doing alright the museum, right?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Right, Professor Keller's been occupied with survey prep for Mount Siesta, and the museum's still under improvement. She's very busy.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: She and you both work at the museum?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Hm? Professor Keller is its curator.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Curator... now, that's something.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Well, um... if you can, please return this book to Kell... to the curator for me.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Where am I? Where am I? Find me if you can ♪
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Take the flowers in, maybe behind them's where I am ♪
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: The little black sheep frolics about, before stopping by a streetlamp.
Bang!
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: The Little Black Sheep leaps into the air, and before Adele's eyes, vanishes like a cloud blown away in the breeze.
With a ring and a clatter, a pebble, two coins, a sheet of paper and a wallet all fall on the ground.
Hide-and-seek ♪
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Mr. Dolly!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Not me!
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: But you didn't spend all of today cooped up inside the museum. You went out for a walk, you ate ice cream, you bought balloons. The sun's fine, the people are wonderful, and you've made a new friend, haven't you?
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: That's the stuff of life!
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: What is the seed you're after? Is this rock a seed?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: You need to look slowly, take your time! The sun tomorrow's just as fine!
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Where am I? Where am I? Find me if you can ♪
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Is it one of these coins? Or what's on this poster...? 'Letter of Intent for Relocation'?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Is a coffee bean the seed, Mr. Dolly?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Take the flowers in, maybe behind them's where I am ♪
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Bang!
attributes.name: Dolly
